appearances.title: Anderson Cooper 360 : CNNW : January 7, 2026 5:00pm-6:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: i'm joined now by democratic senator tammy duckworth from illinois. her state has seen its share of federal agents patrolling its streets. senator duckworth is also a member of the armed services committee. senator duckworth, what is your reaction to what happened in minneapolis today? what may happen in another city tomorrow? >> well, anderson, i want to speak a little bit to what brad was saying. he said, you know, there were police officers doing crowd control that would help. we had police officers helping with crowd control and ice, tear gas, 27, of chicago's finest cpd officers who were out there actually trying to help with crowd control. ice is not made minneapolis safer. and they certainly didn't make chicago safer. and in fact, in chicago, they at one point from the roof of a building, a sniper shot a priest who was on the sidewalk praying for ice. and so, you know, i mean, they shot him with pepper spray with pepper bullets. the problem that i see here from the videos that i've seen, it looked like this person was trying to leave. and remem

appearances.title: The Lead With Jake Tapper : CNNW : January 2, 2026 2:00pm-3:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: and senator tammy duckworth is blaming speaker mike johnson for pulling that provision out of the bill because of concerns about the destruction of some embryos in ivf. she actually sent a letter to trump, who has called himself the father of ivf, saying that speaker johnson is making him the deadbeat dad of ivf. >> what is the speaker's. >> office saying about this? >> they didn't direct directly address duckworth's claims, but they gave us a statement that says president trump and congressionanal congressional republicans have been working to lower costs and expand access to ivf. the speaker has clearly and repeatedly stated he is supportive of access to ivf when sufficient pro-life protections are in place, and he will continue to be supportive when it is done responsibly and ethically. it's important to note johnson's state of louisiana actually has some of the most restrictive ivf regulations in the country. embryos have to be sent out of state in order to be destroyed, but courtney, for instance, and she speaks for a lot of military families who feel this way, she says, denying t

appearances.title: Sen. Schumer & Other Sen. Dems Discuss Housing Costs During the Trump Admin. : CSPAN : January 16, 2026 11:24am-12:03pm EST
appearances.snippet: senators brian schatz and tammy duckworth senator schatz helps create the pro federal housing program which rewards jurisdictions that increase supply of affordable housing by correcting exclusionary zoning and land use policies. we know there is a lot more work to do here, but this is an incredibly important policy. he also co-authored the bipartisan act which encourages localities to cut owners regulations and make it easier to build. senator duckworth has been a strong advocate for safe and affordable housing for the most vulnerable. as the assistant secretary for veterans affairs, she worked to end veteran homelessness and in the senate she fought for new funding to support and modernize public housing. both represent the kind of leadership our country lead -- needs right now, looking for solutions to this crucial problem and i am so grateful that they are here. i would like to welcome you to the stage. [applause]

appearances.title: U.S. Senate U.S. Senate : CSPAN2 : January 15, 2026 9:59am-1:59pm EST
appearances.snippet: we want to empower hud to invoke the defense production act, something tammy duckworth emphasized, guaranteeing the purchase of housing materials in short supply and scaling production of modular and manufactured housing. and we want to create an arpa home to bring down housing costs, just as darpa was able to lower defense costs work he need an arpa for housing. it's a national crisis just as important as defense. so let's get an arpa for housing. and this isn't just talk. democrats have delivered on housing relief when we had the majority. when i was majority leader, we did deliver the largest rental relief package ever. we expanded rental assistance and emergency housing vouchers. we saved millions from eviction in the depths of the covid crisis. now we need expand the rental re -- expanded rental relief to help during the crisis faced by so americans. it's not covid, not happening all at once, but in so many places throughout america. we need the same kind of large rental relief package. in the weeks and months to come, the american people will also hear from democrats on other areas where
